column4: Guys, do you have any idea why I'm not able to mount an ext2 drive?
mount: wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/hdc1,
In some cases useful info is found in syslog - try
EXT2-fs: hdc1: couldn't mount because of unsupported optional features (4).
EXT2-fs: hdc1: couldn't mount because of unsupported optional features (4).
you made it with fedora and want to read it under ubuntu?
are you using a 2.4 kernel now or something?
and you created it under the same kernel?
they're not very well done and can cause problems
when did anyone suggest you were recommending them
because firefox has had numerous security issues since hoary came out
which are fixed in 1.0.2 in the security repository
